head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Arrest In Brooklyn Crash

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Arrest In Brooklyn Crash

body.head.byline: By CARA BUCKLEY; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Jiankai Huang is charged with drunken driving and related charges after crashing his car into two vehicles and hitting three pedestrians in Brooklyn (S)

block.p: Jiankai Huang of Alexandria, Va., was arrested yesterday after crashing his car into a pickup truck and a van and hitting three pedestrians in Brooklyn, the police said. Mr. Huang, 29, was charged with driving while intoxicated, reckless endangerment and driving with a suspended license, the police said. They said that Mr. Huang was driving east on 65th Street at 8:15 a.m. when he hit the truck, which was heading north on Fort Hamilton Parkway, and then the van, which was stopped at a red light. The three injured pedestrians, a woman of 26 and two boys, 13 and 11, were hospitalized, the police said. Mr. Huang's passenger, a 20-year-old woman, was hospitalized with head injuries, and the other drivers for evaluation, the police said.
